page.title: 01Introduction to the Area
page.content:
Our area is located in the north-east part of Staffordshire on the southern edge of the Peak District National Park at approximately 300 m. height O.D. situated partly in an area of limestone and mainly on gritstone moorlands.
Heather, bilberry and crowberry grow on the moorland. In the valleys a tree flora of oak, birch and mountain ash exist with bracken undergrowth.The limestone has a rich variety of shrubs, particularly hawthorn, grasses and flowering plants.
The landscape is attractive to tourists exploring the valleys of the Rivers Hamps, Manifold and Dove. Many additional visitors pass through the area on their way to Alton Towers.
